required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Pactimibe in Patients With Atherosclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Pactimibe on the Progression of Atherosclerosis as Measured by 2-D and 3-D Carotid Ultrasound

brief_summary.textblock: The effect of pactimibe on the reduction of atherosclerosis in the carotid artery will be assessed using carotid ultrasound

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of pactimibe versus placebo on the progression of atherosclerosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of pactimibe versus placebo in patients with atherosclerosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Increased cardiovascular risk (i.e. history of myocardial infarction, stroke, diabetes mellitus, left ventricular hypertrophy)
- Intima-media thickness greater than or equal to 0.8 mm as measured by ultrasonography
- Negative pregnancy test for females
Exclusion Criteria:
- Whole blood donation (greater than or equal to 450 ml) during the last three months before study start
- Unstable angina, congestive heart failure or uncontrolled hypertension
- Renal disease including nephrectomy and/or renal transplant
- Hepatic disease or abnormal liver function parameters
- Drug abuse or alcohol addiction

overall_official.last_name: P U Witte, MD, PhD, FFPM
